instructions.1: Stir oats into 3 cups water in a saucepan; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until the oats are tender and the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
instructions.2: Stir 2 cups hot water into the cooked oats. Strain water to use as 'oat broth' into a large sauce pan. Save cooked oats for another use.
instructions.3: Stir pumpkin puree, sugar, herbes de Provence, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder into the oat broth with a whisk until smooth; add olive oil and stir to combine. Thin the gravy with more hot water, if desired. Place the saucepan over medium heat, bring the gravy to a simmer, and cook until hot, about 10 minutes.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the saucepan from Step 1 being used?

Is saucepan from Step 1 still available in Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 3?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to place the saucepan in Step 3?
Can we stir (Step 1) and stir (Step 2) at the same time?
